newsitem.title: FRANCE: Cr Lyonnais to cost France 130 bln Ffr.
newsitem.headline: Cr Lyonnais to cost France 130 bln Ffr.

text.p: The total cost to put ailing state-owned bank Credit Lyonnais back on its feet will be about 130 billion francs ($22.6 billion), a French member of parliament said on Wednesday.
Patrick Devedjian, a member of the National Assembly's finance committee, said the bailout would cost the state "of the order of 130 billion francs".
Estimates of what it will cost to fix Credit Lyonnais, France's worst banking disaster, range as high as 150 billion francs but the government has never given a precise figure.
On February 28, Finance Minister Jean Arthuis said in a radio interview that the debacle would cost France's taxpayers "well above 50 billion francs".
